pullRequest.title: Water Area checks
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description:
This should fix #345.
This pull request should depend upon #332 .
Potential Impact:
There should be no down-stream impact at this time. This may change (intersection logic).
Unit Test Approach:
Unit tests are largely for false negatives, but there are some false positive checks as well.
Test Results:
Describe other (non-unit) test results here. In case of a new check or enhancements to existing
checks, please add details on how many countries the check was tested on,
total flag counts, FP rate etc. (see below example).



ISO
Total Flags
Sampled
Sampling %

[1] As with #332, most of the issues are from a poorly done import. The single FP from the sample was from a natural=water + water=stream_pool. This is a true false positive, and could be ameliorated by changing the WATER_FILTERS static variable. (something like natural->water&water->*&water->!stream_pool|waterway->riverbank).
[2] Like the previous water area check (#332 ), this appears to be due to clipping at the border, and not due to logic issues.
